website_summaries.verdict: A superior electric wine opener with state-of-the-art features.
pros: Stylish and elegant stainless steel construction
Blue LED light activated when in use or charging
Opens up to 30 bottles per charge
cons: Not everyone is a fan of the LED light

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful wine opener
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bad boy for work. The reviews were either great or people were upset about the battery. Ive had it at work over a month now and opened 1000s of bottles of wine with ease with it. I give this thing raving live reviews. I havent had a cork break off or any cork in the bottles since i purchased it. If the motor had gone out after 100 bottled id have called it worth my money but its still working 1000s later. It does seem to be going a little slower and the charger base is getting a tad finicky but ill just order another happily when it does go out.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Mozingo

customer_reviews.title: They both love it. My mom has arthritis pretty bad in ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for both my mother and step mother on mothers day. They both love it. My mom has arthritis pretty bad in her hands but loves wine. This product saves her hands from having to grip and twist the cork bottle opener. You can have a bottle of wine opened in four seconds with this product. The foil remover is super spiffy too because no more sliding a knife carefully around the edge! Just place over the foil, grip together and twist in one motion. This is a great product and as soon as I'm not broke anymore I'm getting myself one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's the Tops
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sucker for wine bottle openers. I thought the rabbit ear openers were the ultimate when they appeared on the market. As arthritis came with age, I found that even the rabbit ear could be difficult to use at times. When the electric bottle openers appeared, they held promise, but were unreliable and short lived. The Secura is the first one I have used that is a solid performer. On a single charge, the Secura is able to open several bottles without hesitation. Other similar openers petered out quickly and lost torque. This works well with artificial and composite corks. The Secura works so well that I'm disappointed now when I'm confronted with a screwcap top instead.
customer_reviews.author: Cooking Texan

customer_reviews.title: That sucked. However
customer_reviews.text: Ordered an Oster first and when it arrived the box was damaged. I took a picture and sent it to Amazon when I received it, but it was a gift and the recipient didn't open it for a few weeks. The Oster was broken, but Amazon/Oster won't do anything about it because I told them it was broken 30 days after I bought it. That sucked. However, I bought this Secura Stainless Steel Electric Wine Bottle Opener to replace the other and this one is a big hit. The light is cool and my friend loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wine opener
customer_reviews.text: This electric cork puller is easy to use for anyone but a godsend for persons with arthritic hands. I have had it for a year or so and it has functioned flawlessly. The rechargeable battery pack has so far shown no signs of giving out, though someday it will and there appears to be no way to replace it.. The charging base with its blue light is (to me) elegant. The foil cutter that comes with it is ok but not special. Update 11/16/18: After 2 and 1/2 years, the battery has given out.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Mordes

customer_reviews.title: It lasted a whole month before it never held it's ...
customer_reviews.text: It lasted a whole month before it never held it's charge. incredible that it could stop working in for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Karvelas

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I just got it yesterday and was excited to try it out. First it looks so cool with its blue light. The foil cutter is awesome, took a second and cut the foil perfectly. Next I simply centered the corkscrew in the middle of the cork, pressed the down button and voila the cork came out, push the up button and cork is removed from the bottle opener. Why didn't I get this before? As to how long it will last, time will tell but so far I love it and I'll probably buy more as gifts. Ok, so few months later, still works great and I bought about 4 more as gifts. All receipients love it!!
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: Might be the worst Amazon purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t use it till return window closed. Does not work. Pulls cork halfway out than shuts off. Might be the worst Amazon purchase ever. Revised review: Contacted company after I found Paperwork saying that the opener had a one year warranty. Contacted company and they sent me a replacement no charge. Hopefully it will last.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mc Dermott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for wine lovers
customer_reviews.text: I've have been looking for a reliable wine bottle opener for my wine bar/cart. This looks very stylish and comes with a nice base. It comes with the foil cutter so you don't need to purchase anything extra. It stays lit up while it is on the charging base. I guess it doubles as a nightlight. Very easy to use and stays charged for quite a while. I left it off the charger for a few days and it still worked. Would be a great gift for a wine lover.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget R

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Nice price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My wife and I have had this new opener for nearly a year and have not had any problems with it. We like to leave it plugged in all the time and having it sitting on top of our wine refrigerator (which also has blue LED lights inside). The blue glowing lights compliment each other and look cool. We enjoyed this opener so much, we purchased another one for a friend as a birthday gift.
customer_reviews.author: Boiler

customer_reviews.title: Really nice little gadget
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do and looks really cool. The foil cutter is awesome as well. When not in use it makes a nice night light and conversation piece. With a decent manual corkscrew costing $10 it's not a big deal to spend $20 and not struggle with the tougher corks.An electric corkscrew is certainly not a necessity, and I like manual openers as well, but if you like gadgets or struggle with wine corks you will like the Secura SWO- 3N
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Best Wine Opener Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: This wine opener is easy to use and reliable. It really is the best wine opener I have ever owned. The blue light stays lit as I keep it plugged in all the time so it serves as a kitchen nightlight as well. It has never pushed a cork into the bottle like my previous opener and the foil cutter on the right side cuts through the foil wrapping every time too. Im actually thinking about gifting one of these to my brother.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Christian

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I don't drink wine often but when I do I wanted the ease of opening a bottle of corked wine. Very disappointed in this product. The actual cork screw just snapped and broke off in the cork. Would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hope L. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have a weak bone issue. It became difficult to use a traditional method of opening my bottles so I tried this nifty tool. Yes! Success! Works like a charm with no undue pressure on any bones. Even worked well on Kendall Jackson corks, which can be real boogers! Looking forward to many more opportunities to drink a bit of wine using this safe method! Now if I can just keep it to one or two glasses! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several different rechargeable wine openers in this price rangein the past. They all worked pretty well but eventually stopped working for either battery or Other, likely electrical, problem. This one is not as heavy and ergonomically easier to operate. Battery life is great so far. I don’t know if it uses lithium type batteries or not but I always removed the charging cord from the mount unless it needs charging. I have not counted the number of bottles it has opened so far on the first charge but it is likely somewhere near 50. The cork handling function is far superior to the others I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Great opener
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the old school way of opening wine bottles. But lately it is so hard to find quality corkscrews to open them flawlessly. I used to have a rabbit which was great, last 10 years and finally broke. They do not make them the same anymore and the one I've had for a year, just broke. So I've decided to go the electric way and it's been a pleasure. While I have heard that the electrics will only last about two years, it's fine with me. Great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Sharyn

customer_reviews.title: Wine Opener is good; Secura customer service is excellent
customer_reviews.text: The opener worked as expected until - just a few weeks before the one-year warranty would expire - the opener just stopped while extracting a cork. I sent Secura a photo of the opener with the cork stuck inside. They promptly sent me a new opener with absolutely no hassle. I was surprised and very pleased. I will be buying more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: DorisM

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks great
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with a range of mechanical corkscrews this baby does the trick. It can easily pull the tightest cork without strain. Both large and small hands can use this (although my wife did need to try it a couple of times before learning to hold the device securely while the corkscrew worked the cork out of the bottle. It's an attractive, modern-looking device that sits in an illuminated holder, giving it a classy look. Included in the stand is the foil cap remover that actually works very well (not all do). I've been using it for several months and dozens of bottles (okay, I'm a lush) and it always delivers.
customer_reviews.author: VSH

customer_reviews.title: Opening a bottle of wine does not get any easier than this.
customer_reviews.text: I found this opener to work very well. The attached foil cutter is the best I have ever used and the corkscrew going through the clear bottom of the opener makes it easy to see that it is going into the bottle straight. I am very pleased with how easily operated this item is and recommend it. It also looks very nice on my counter with the blue light shining through, showing it is ready for use. It comes nicely packaged in a sturdy, attractive box so would wrap very nicely for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wine opener for the dollar. I’ve had three others that lasted less than eight months as we put them through heavy use. This one is much heavier battery life is better and it stronger. The last two would get stuck trying to take difficult corks out. This one does not
customer_reviews.author: Penewise

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of other brands of electric wine bottle openers, but this one is a cut above the others. Two features I really like about this one are the see-thru area where the corkscrew is and the fact that it's just so much quieter than the others that I've owned. The see-thru area is nice since one can see the progress of the cork extraction and it also serves as a way to see any obstructions that may impede its operation. Overall, this appears to be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: TekStro

customer_reviews.title: Great wine opener
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wine opener for my own use at home and I like it very much. At first I thought it was struggling to do the job but, no, it wasn't. It takes a lot of pull to remove some wine corks and it works very well every time. I plan to purchase a couple more for gifts this year.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, works out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I thought that we have to charge it right out of the box but the opener did work right away. Everything is packaged nicely within the box and you can put them back once done for storage as well. There's an instruction that came with it but it's really just using the cap cutter to cut out the cover, and then press the down arrow all the way until the cork is fully outside; and finally press the up arrow to get the cork out of the opener.
customer_reviews.author: Huang's Family

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. It was defective. Thing wobbled all over the place when sitting on the charger base and I had to wiggle it just to get the blue light to come on. I don’t know if it was fully charged when I used it but the inside does not look like it will hold up well and it was very slow compared to my old one from oster. I thought it was going to break midway through. I could have just gotten a bad one, but I would look some more before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Gena Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Best ever wine bottle opener!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic foil cutter on all size bottle necks! Once charged, mine last for 4 months! Quick to recharge! I disconnect charger from base until ready to recharge, and I store in the base. Yes, it is a little ‘wobbly’ in base, but not a real problem! I haven given two as gifts and everyone loves it? Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: tvilleknees

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious look
customer_reviews.text: This product is has a fancy design and is super quiet! It's easy to use and within seconds you will have wine ready to pour. Hassle free and a neat way to open bottles of wine. It lights up blue, easy to recharge and most definitely a good product to give as a gift. Comes with warranty if texting to confirm your product and might come with additional gift after confirmation of order.
customer_reviews.author: Babi Gendut

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction Junction
customer_reviews.text: Had this product and loved it...until it broke. I was very careful and never let it over-charge (I never left it plugged in to long to strain the battery) yet it still broke. I had a few friends who had the same one. They left their plugged in all the time and left ir on the charger and theirs died after one year. I was very careful and only got 15 months shelf life out mine. I will buy a new electric wine opener again, just NOT this brand. To bad, because when it was working it worked great!!!! HOWEVER a product should last longer than 15 months! Pretty dissapointed
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and great functionality
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for another brand I had for 10 years. I love this choice. The styling is classy and I love being able to see through the bottom. That helps to see where the corkscrew is which is helpful to align it with the middle of the cork when you start to decork. The blue light is nice but with so many appliances with power or display lights in the average kitchen it would be nice to turn the light off if you want. The foil cutter is well made and has a slot on the base to keep it handy. I look forward to enjoying this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: D Gartside

customer_reviews.title: Not
customer_reviews.text: The top of cork screw isnt sharp enough, it pushed the cork down into the wine when opening. I made sure the opener is fill charged and in right position. Im extremely dissatisfied and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maiko

customer_reviews.title: Opener is perfect
customer_reviews.text: We've used this regularly for three months and we're very happy with it. Wife and I both appreciate the ease of use and consistently smooth operation. Remove the foil with a quick rotation of the foil remover, point the opener at the cork, press switch down to remove the cork, and press switch up to release the cork from the opener. We have come to use the bright LED light as our kitchen nightlight. Nothing I would change about this opener.
customer_reviews.author: E. Adamy

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity Meets Modern Life
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding electric, automatic, easy-to-use opener. Looks great sitting in the recharging stand and will go with any decor. It just doesn’t get any easier to open a bottle of wine. This replaces a much more expensive manual opener and we’re very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sometimes Jones

customer_reviews.title: Requires 2 hands to open bottle. Opener stopped working just days after a year.
customer_reviews.text: This attractive opener worked well for a few months, and opened a wine bottle easily. However, it stopped working just days after a year. It still charged. It just no longer worked. One note that may or may not be important to you is that opening a wine bottle with the opener definitely requires two hands, one to hold the bottle still while you are trying to open it and the other to hold and operate the opener. (As the corkscrew goes into the cork, the bottle starts turning and has to be held still with one hand while you work the opener with the other hand.)
customer_reviews.author: LAC

customer_reviews.title: Broken corks
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I was sold a defective product because the 2nd and 4th use just broke up my corks into the bottle. I lost two bottles of wine thanks to this opener and by the time I tried to send it back, the window was closed for returns. I'm shocked it has such high reviews because I didn't experience this.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie T Soto

customer_reviews.title: 2 tries and 2 fails
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and when we received it, it would only work in reverse. ie it would not go in the direction to take the cork out. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and returned and ordered a new one. There was no refund option as the sales price I received the 1st time was "sold out". We we received the second one the corkscrew is off set so it goes into the cork at an angel making it bog down and feel like it is going to break the wine bottle. I will also be returning this one and purchasing a different brand!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I bought this opener about 2 months ago and it already stopped working. The corkscrew will not descend to get the cork out. A product like this should not last all of 2 months. I contacted the company who said i would be receiving an email from the manager and that never came either. Extremely disappointed in the product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: arbv1020

customer_reviews.title: Awesome at first
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this wine opener for the first year or so. Then the battery developed a charge memory and would barely open 1 bottle. Had to get rid of it really too bad the battery couldn't be easily replaced or be of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Egan

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wine opener for the ease of opening. What they don't tell you is that the rechargeable batteries will die and you can't replace them because they are sealed in the unit. It says that the opener comes with a one year warranty. Mine quit working 6 days after my warranty was no longer valid, and it was actually getting slower well before that. I didn't do anything because I thought it was slow because of the cork. So, ease of use, it's a good purchase, but this one, only if you plan on replacing it often
customer_reviews.author: Temla Staum

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for a month or so and it just stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a month or so and it just stopped pulling the corks out of a bottle. The motor works, but the cork screw doesn't move. I tried to return it but was told I am outside of the return window. Certainly wouldn't recommend it. You will like it at first, but not after
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful device!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this opener look beautiful, but it’s simple and practical to use. I didn’t even have to glance at the instructions, just picked it up and used it. Everything made good sense, was intuitive and simple. I originally purchased this because I broke my wrist and, of all the things I couldn’t manage without the use of my right hand, opening a bottle of wine seemed to be most solvable. I read the reviews and opted for this opener — though it definitely wasn’t the most expensive, so I had a twinge of doubt. But, I was so pleased with its beauty and graceful use that I ordered several more to give as gifts this Christmas. Nicely done!
customer_reviews.author: whereverigo

customer_reviews.title: This was it and she is delighted with it
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has issues with her hands and is not very strong. Other than me, she needed an opener that she could use with one hand. This was it and she is delighted with it. Also, a little amusing, it comes with an excellent stainless steel foil cutter. Rather than the small wheels that most cutters have, they are large and effective. In fact, she cut the top off one bottle of wine before realizing that it was a screw-off top. The tasteful bue light is also an attractive addition to our kitchen. Cudos.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: Died After 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours researching wine openers and, since they all looked lie they are made by the same company, I relied on the multiple good reviews about this one...So what could go wrong? How about a defective switch? I bought the opener in January and used it daily...until the switch stopped ...dead... in April...No warning, no misuse..no nothing...
customer_reviews.author: Public

customer_reviews.title: Makes opening corks significantly easier
customer_reviews.text: Makes opening corks significantly easier. I've only used it 3 times so I can't speak to battery life yet. The device is supposed to open 30 corks on a charge. The instructions recommend returning the opener to the charging station to protect it from damage--it doesn't say whether to disconnect the power in between charges or just keep in charging. Anyway, it's attractive, works well and it was a nice bonus to get a foil cutter.
customer_reviews.author: KayW in MD

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed using it for a very short time.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this opener in April 2018 to replace one that failed after three years of use. I have loved using it until it quit working on June 16th. I had a dinner party and we did use it to open four bottles over the evening. However, on the fourth attempt the screw would not move down or up. It was always on the charger and would light up but just spin and not move up or down. So disappointed as it was great while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Loved it up until this month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 6 months ago. Loved it up until this month. Stopped charging even after days of being plugged in. Just spins in place. Don't buy this, short term satisfaction. Can't even return now. Don't be tempted by the quantity of positive reviews they probably didn't wait long enough for this product to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Elbee

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace a Oster bottle opener very similar in design. The Oster lasted many years but when time came to replace it went with this model as a nicely priced alternative. So far it is working well...perhaps even better than the Oster did. Nice stand, nice blue accent light, like the see through design to see cork's disposition and the ability to ensure opener does not still have a cork from the last bottle opened still stuck inside. Like the stand and the ability that the stand can be used to insure the opener is always fully charged. Time will tell if it is durable over the long term.
customer_reviews.author: K & TR, MN

customer_reviews.title: Good looking corkscrew.
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking electric corkscrew. It is a big plus that you can see where the worm is entering the cork so you can make sure it's centered. It does seem like the motor is struggling to pull the cork as it goes quite slow which is why I subtracted 1 star. So far it worked fine through 10 bottles or so including some artificial corks. Currently I am testing to see how many bottles it will open without recharging as the claim is for 30. The foil cutter is excellent, one of the best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Winemaker949

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a cool gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my girlfriend as a gift and we love it. It's easy to use, looks stylish, and is effective. I like that it comes with a foil cutting tool too. How it charges is a concern though. There are two, small metal prongs in the base that charges the opener. If those prongs get damaged, then the base is useless and you can't charge the opener. The product manual actually states that unless you are using it frequently, to charge it only once every 2-3 months. We don't keep it in the base because we don't want to damage the charger. That aside, it's a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: MS454

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great device, but sadly after only using it 3 times (and yes, I followed the instructions!), it broke. The plastic pieces that hold the metal top and the bottom together broke off. I hope this was just a defective one, because it got good reviews, hence that's why I purchased it. Not sure if I will try it again. On a positive note, it was extremely easy to use. I have some arthritis in my hands, so using a manual opener can be challenging at times. This seemed like a good solution!
customer_reviews.author: lpa

customer_reviews.title: Problems with units but great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Second one since 2016. Quits charging every two years or after 1 year warranty ends. I contacted the company who pointed out that both units were out of warranty and offered a new unit at a discounted price plus no shipping. So while I’m not sold on the unit, customer service is excellent. We’ll give them a 3rd try.
customer_reviews.author: Judi Ross

customer_reviews.title: Cool item but short life.
customer_reviews.text: Initially I enjoyed using this wine opener. It worked great and looked cool! Unfortunately it died within 4 months. Amazon was kind enough to refund my money even though it was beyond the return date. Hoping that it was just a glitch I purchased another one. Same exact story. It died in a few months. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Molina

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER JUST 8 USES, but company replaced it immediately!
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM WAS BEAUTIFUL AND ESY TO USE. PROBLEM IS IT ONLY OPENED ABOUT 8 BOTTLES OF WINE SINCE CHRISTMAS AND NOW IT IS BROKEN. THE BUTTON THAT YOU PUSH TO REMOVE THE CORK NO LONGER TURNS ON THE UNIT. THE BUTTON TO PUSH THE CORK OFF OF THE CORKSCREW STILL WORKS. USELESS. IT IS MADE IN CHINA. I WON'T BUY FROM THERE AGAIN. Adding to my review. The customer service was GREAT. The company has already sent a replacement. I'd rate it higher, but first I have to see. how long the replacement lasts. I'll be back!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good opener
customer_reviews.text: I've used this opener only a few times but have really liked it. We had another brand that died and replaced it with the Secura. It's nice to be able to see exactly where the corkscrew is entering the cork as the old opener sometimes went in off center. It's also quieter, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Linlie

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. Use it. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third purchase of this great product! I have one in three rooms of the house now so I’m prepared (or lazy!) from any place! The original is still going strong after daily use for over 2 years. This one is a no-brainer and well worth twice the $20 purchase price!!
customer_reviews.author: BLU

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I have a connective tissue disorder which has begun to seriously weaken the strength in my thumbs in particular and hands in general. This wine opener is so easy to use and does all the hard work! It sometimes makes a strange "clicking" noise which made me afraid I was breaking it but is still works perfectly! The foil cutter is even superior to any others I've owned (and I am a regular wine drinker so I've owned a few!). I highly recommend this very reasonably priced wine opener.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lyn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! As an event planned I am going through wine peters like they are going out of style. I was really hesitant to buy this one because I own a Rabbit Wine opener that was much more expensive that I love. I didn't want to spend a lot because they tend to go missing at parties all the time. I do not let this one out of my sight, you can't beat the price. Well made and love how cool it looks when its charging and lit up.
customer_reviews.author: MacKenzie Blackman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mom, who has arthritis in her hands, a year ago. She loves it! But I am writing a review today because it recently stopped working. Secura has provided FANTASTIC customer service, and are shipping me a replacement. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Molly B. Fuhr

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Mom likes it. She has been an office person typing made crazy all day every day for 30 years and this saves her fingers just a little bit longer.. comes with a knife thing that spins around the plastic seal, peal it off, put the device around the neck of the bottle, press the down button and watch the screw head go into the cork in around 5 seconds lol and press the up button to extract the cork. No force is necessary and looks cool while charging. Uhhhh I would not use this as a male 'device' lmao
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and performed flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and performed flawlessly. I couldn't be happier. Bought one for my daughter-in-law and she loves it too. Just hold the bottle with one hand, center the corkscrew tip in the center of the cork, apply a gentle pressure downward and press the button with your thumb. It took only a few seconds for the cork to come all the way out. Click the button again and the cork falls right off. Looks very pretty on a counter or bar with it's blue light. It's one of the reasons I bought this one over the more popular ones.
customer_reviews.author: Felucca

customer_reviews.title: Great Opener
customer_reviews.text: This opener is the best I have ever used! I am 84 and have been drinking wine since age 14. How many bottles I have strained to open with clumsy gadgets that sometimes didn't work is beyond my memory. This is actually fun to use. I have used it on about 15 bottles so far but it looks like it should last a long time. It would make a good gift for a wine drinker.
customer_reviews.author: The Gator

customer_reviews.title: It came apart
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this wine opener. I've only used it about a dozen times and when I opened a bottle of wine tonight it came apart. I'm very disappointed as I really liked it. I would hate to give it as a gift and have it do that to the recipient. I put the ring back on the bottom but there are 2 little silver things that I guess would make contact w/the base to charge it. I will no longer be able to charge it. So when the battery dies down it's of no use. It's over 30 days so I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hanshaw

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but you have to know how to use it
customer_reviews.text: You have to get it just right in order to remove corks. May take you a few bottles of trial & error before you remove a cork perfectly. I put a friend in charge of removing the corks at a wine party and he got so frustrated that he just did the manual cork remover and tossed this aside!
customer_reviews.author: bam

customer_reviews.title: Mine stopped working with light use by 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked. Never a problem. Then all of a sudden the low button stopped responding. Only the button to dump the cork from the opener works. Can’t open wine now! Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E.

customer_reviews.title: Isn't Charging
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this wine opener. Easy to operate. Left it on the charger 24/7 as the instructions state. After four months I noticed that the blue charging light wasn't lit. I have tried unplugging and plugging into different outlet and still no blue light for charging. Very dissapointed. Only opened 6 or 8 bottles.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: It didn't hold up under light use
customer_reviews.text: It was amazingly easy to uncork a wine bottle and then release the cork. I was leaning towards wine brands that use a cap instead of a cork rather than struggle with a corkscrew. The only problem was that after it had opened half a dozen bottles of wine, in the midst of removing a cork, the plastic ring at the bottom of the corkscrew cover fell off and the spring dropped out onto the counter. I'm going to contact the seller to find out if I can fix it. It's one of those clever devices that makes life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: M in FLA

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I had tried a few wine bottle openers before with no great success. I had a favorite manual one and stuck with it until it broke after many years of usage. I decided to try electric again, this one was attractive and price was good. I pluged it in on my wine cooler and the pretty blue light matches the light of the coolers making the display very attractive. When I tried the product I was amazed how great it works, I love that it pulls the cork perfectly leaving the cork easy to re-use on the bottle. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal M

customer_reviews.title: Risky purchase, doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Started out well. Worked great for 9 months. Fully charged and cork removal feature (reverse function) still works but with the downward (cork boring function) feature...nothing. No movement, no sound, zero. Very disappointed it did not hold up even for a year; and probably used it no more than twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: An essential part of life!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift from my brother-in-law (thanks, Bruce!). Works like a charm and always ready to help. Outside of allowing me to drink more & faster, there are no perceivable downsides to this unit. And guests are always intrigued by the blue light on the front and when I show them how it works (oops, another open bottle!), they are appropriately impressed. In the spirit of paying forward, I just bought one for my neighbor across the street. He was MOST grateful. So there.
customer_reviews.author: RichardB

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  What a product!!!  Works great!  Easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line one of the best items I bought for $20.00 or less from AMAZON. Out the box with out charging it I opened a bottle wine that the cork was mutilated by a hand opener. Open the bottle like a champ. Wen it is charging it has all blue light that the kids love! (It is amazing hos easily they are entertained) For you SCI-FI fans out there, when it is charging it looks like a light-saber! Hands down, awesome product. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eric M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No more broken bottles or ruined corks!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I love, love, love it!! I was going to have my husband show me how to use it, but it's so simple that I did it myself! You use the cutter to cut off the foil+ place the opener on top of the bottle holding firmly,push the button and the drill part goes into the cork and removes the cork.I bought rubber caps to cover the bottle afterwards.This works like a dream and would make a great gift for a wine lover! Also plugs in to charge!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Bocchetti

customer_reviews.title: Opener=great, cutter=not a cutter
customer_reviews.text: I have had the exact same opener at my own house for three years, and decided to order a new one to give a friend as a housewarming gift. I was so excited to see her joy, and the electric opener worked beautifully. However, I was incredibly disappointed that it seemed they had messed up the cutter. It’s completely missing the blades that cut the foil. My friend still likes her gift, but it’s embarrassing that it wasn’t make properly. I want a cutter that works for her, but it’s not worth sending back the entire opener just to get a new cutter.
customer_reviews.author: iDiddy

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool, operates weakly, not as sturdy/powerful as other electric openers
customer_reviews.text: The company did replace my first opener even though I didn't try it out for longer period of time than normal. It didn't sit well in the charging base. The second one is still a little shaky in the base, but not as bad as the first one. It does not have the power of other electric openers and sounds as if it will die before even opening the 1st bottle off of charger. I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Dippiedip

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I have arthritis in both of my hands/wrists and it was beginning increasingly difficult to use wine openers, even the ones that say they are made for people with arthritis. I cannot say enough how much I love it! It's so easily to use, I hardly have to think about it. My wine options are no longer limited to screw caps! The charging station lights up while it's charging (which doubles as a night light for midnight water runs). I've not had to take it off the charger for an extended time yet, but I'm looking forward to bringing it up for snowboarding days and camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie M.

customer_reviews.title: Charging port is extremely fragile
customer_reviews.text: At the bottom of the wine opener are two small metal clips that connect to the charging station, allowing it to charge. These metal clips are about as thin as a sheet of aluminum, and repeated use of the wine opener will eventually wear them down. One of those clips fell off about 6 months in, and I managed to glue it back on so that it can still charge. Last week, another one fell off and disappeared, so now I'm left with an electric wine opener that can never be charged again. Note that I'm not a frequent user of this wine opener (at most once every two weeks), and I'm not throwing it around aggressively either.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Yang

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently started drinking wine and I had an old manual wine opener that destroyed the cork and got it in the wine. I thought I was just doing it wrong, but as it turns out it was just a bad tool. I splurged and got this and it has been a God send! It looks super sleek on my counter and it opens bottles within seconds. And the corks aren't all torn up and I'm now collecting them for decoration. However it is a tiny bit loud, but it doesn't bother me. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a new wine opener!
customer_reviews.author: sleeplessinohio

customer_reviews.title: Everything
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my wife and she loves wine. I wouldn’t stand between her and a bottle of this crack like substance of my life depends on it. The cork is thing standing between her and a sip of this sweet nectar. This product has positively saved our marriage. It seems to keep the fire burning one cork after another without fail! I would recommend this product to any husband or man with “better half”. If not you will have to deal with them without alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cheap battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought it Feb 2018 and always keep it in the charger and used it maybe a dozen times. Each time I use it on a plastic cork it bogs down and barely screws into the cork. The battery keeps getting weaker and weaker and the battery is not accessable. The pretty blue charging light makes a nice night light but I might have to return to the old hand crank model and give up on battery models.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: far it is an excellent performer. It replaced a Brookstone electric wine opener ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the Secura electric wine opener about a month now, but use it several times a week. So, far it is an excellent performer. It replaced a Brookstone electric wine opener (a model no longer available from them) which I had for several years and was quite pleased with it until lately the black plastic housing started to get soft and tacky. That is one reason the Secura wine opener appealed to me...the stainless steel housing. My only complaint, and it is a very minor one, is that the foil cutter mounting technique requires two hands to remove and replace. The Brookstone one was an easy one-hand operation.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: easy, and the blue glow at night is pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, who saw one in a restaurant and commented how interesting it was. When it arrived she was somewhat disturbed that I bought this "on an impulse" but was resigned to try it out. Now we both use it all the time! It's fast, easy, and the blue glow at night is pretty cool. I paid full price for this, so my comments aren't based on a feeling of obligation for getting a reduced price (hint hint, Amazon. Your customers are on to that review scam)
customer_reviews.author: D. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wine opener
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this electric wine opener and have used it twice so far. It makes opening a bottle of wine extremely easy! It pulls the cork out smoothly and then removes the cork from the screw. It does have an attractive blue light that comes on when using the opener. The foil remover works perfectly. The unit is attractive and sits on the counter. Glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Great Wine Opener!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few automatic wine openers and this is the best by far. It has a clear bottom so that you can see where the cork is which makes it easy to know when to stop the process and when you can safely remove the cork. I've already sent one to my son who just loves it as well! It's a definite gift option. Before you know it, the holidays will be here and this will make for a great hostess gift or Christmas gift for the wine lovers in your life. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Wingate

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in Feb 2019 as a gift to my husband for Valentines Day. Since then we've only used this 3 times. The 3rd time we tried to use it which was on Mother's Day 2019 it wouldn't work at all. It completely stopped working altogether. I should've listened to the other reviews from people who had the same issue with this product. I guess the saying is true "you get what you pay for". Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey MH

customer_reviews.title: Great Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wine opener for my husband for Christmas. He loved it! Unfortunately, the down button mechanism quit working after about 9 months. The device carries a `1 year warranty so I e-mailed Secura, they responded immediately promising a replacement, and within a week we had a new opener. We were so happy with the device and pleased with the customer service that I ordered the newer model so that we could have one to travel with. So far it is great. We would highly recommend this product. In today's world it is really impressive to have such responsive and reliable customer service.
customer_reviews.author: MMO

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly - love that it has see-through window so that you can ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly - love that it has see-through window so that you can tell if corkscrew is lining up. Similar automatic openers usually lack this feature and you can't tell if corkscrew is properly aligned. Unlike my other foil cutters, this one actually works! Super sharp and has its own handy storage so that it is always there - no need to rummage through a drawer to find it. And, the night light feature is a big plus - the soft blue light is a nice addition to the kitchen at night. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: IAmAzon

customer_reviews.title: The COOLEST opener
customer_reviews.text: I bought this opener for my husband for Christmas. It's not the one he asked for, but it looked so cool and had so many great reviews,I took a chance and purchased this one. He loves it! He said he likes it better than the one he was looking at and every time he uses it he is delighted and says, "This is the COOLEST thing!"
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Something that’s so beautiful shouldn’t work so well.
customer_reviews.text: This works so well that it’s almost hard to believe. Place it on top of the wine bottle’s cork or on the foil covering the cork. Press the well- located switch and the corkscrew rotates and sinks easily into the cork, fully extracts it and when reversed, drops the cork. The device is actually beautiful — carefully designed to look good while sitting on its charger.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and works well
customer_reviews.text: Love the light the comes on when you open a bottle and also comes on while you are charging the opener. ( I don't keep it plugged in after it's charged) Also like that you can see through the bottom to line up the cork. Love the feel of the stainless steel over my old black plastic opener that got gummy. Hopefully this will last for a long time. Looks very stylish sitting on my wine bar.
customer_reviews.author: Zrobster

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product in November and it lasted 5 months. Used it a hand full of times. The 4th or 5th time I tried to use it, I noticed the it struggling to open the bottle. Now the unit no longer accepts a charge of any kind. Hasn't been dropped or mistreated.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: this is an ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE product: i have now purchased a total of SEVEN for myself and family. FIVE of the SEVEN broke within the first use or two. of those FIVE, FOUR were returned (one broke just after the 30 day return window closed) and, ALL FOUR of those broke. STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MHF

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 2 months 😢
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this wine opener for 2 months and loved it until now. However, something is wrong in the switch now and it will not twist the screw down into the cork. The button to reverse it still works. Very disappointed because it was easy to use and looked pretty sitting on the counter. But definitely can’t recommend based on only working for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Susie S. Hartema

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working on 2/29/2020 - 2 days after Amazon's return window closed - and after having it for a month and only using it occasionally. I am NOT happy with the product OR Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mezzavoce

customer_reviews.title: I should of bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: with as many wine bottles I have opened, I should of bought one of these years ago. The wife has always had trouble opening wine bottles, so this is the perfect solution. It lights up with a neat little blue light when put away that lets you know that you have put it down correctly for the unit to be charged. So far very happy with the unit and hope it last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: GeeeSus C

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fun
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy simple gadgets that make my life easy. I've never had a hard time opening wine bottles but why put so much work into it when you can just press a button? This thing removes the cork in one piece in just a few seconds. I love that it has the light. There really isn't a reason for it but it's pretty and it looks cool. My only gripe is the foil cutter is a little fiddly to get on and off its little hook. That is the ONLY reason it's not 5 stars. If I could give 4.5 stars I would because it's such a small thing.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Grannis

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because it's a great concept. Opened the wine bottles so easily, almost too good to be true, then just stopped working after only a couple of months. I got as a gift for my husband for Father's Day. Only used on weekends a couple of times. Very disappointed that we couldn't get much use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: GTGal

customer_reviews.title: Dies after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my parents last Christmas (2018). I spent a lot of time looking at reviews to get them a good one that will last. However, after 3-4 months of use it stopped working completely. It's a bit upsetting and embarrassing that this product did not last very long at all. Wish I had spent a little more on something that was not cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Delight to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of the Oster openers which worked fine until a cork broke inside. On one occasion I spent an hour trying to chip the cork out with success. Other times not so much. And good luck attempting to disassemble and reassemble. I recently broke a cork with my new Secura. First off you can see the cork remnant which was very helpful figuring out how to proceed. I simply pushed the inner sleeve in to engage and grab the cork then used the normal eject procedure. This is a very nice well priced tool for opening your wine bottles.
customer_reviews.author: dliverpool

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that the unit took almost 16 hours instead of 8 to charge. In addition, after struggling to open one bottle of wine, it would not completely open the second bottle.....had to recharge. So, while this is a nice looking unit, I will return it for a refund and purchase a different unit from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: ClayKindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed but it does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time and it felt like it didnt have enough “horsepower”. As it pulled the cork it started whining, the plastic mechanism creaked and moved around. I thought it was going to break right there but thankfully it didnt. We are glad we have this, but next time we’ll shop around and not go with “Amazon Choice” or “Best Rated”.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Broke in half after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: This item broke in less than a month. It says U.S. company in the description but the product itself is made in China. The metal half is attached to the plastic half with flimsy plastic pieces that snapped off, leaving the item in two unusable pieces in only a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Most satisfying, and enduring, 20 dollar purchase I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.text: This item is in a small group of items, that for the money, I have been incredibly satisfied with over time. I have had this for over a year and I absolutely love it. Despite my not quite centering the cork a few times it has still worked beautifully. Having said that, do your best to make sure it is centered because I think you could crack the plastic on the end where the corkscrew is housed if you’re off center too much. It is so quick, easy, and reliable, I only wished I hadn’t waited so long to purchase. Truly one of the most worthwhile 20 dollar purchases I have made.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaIndia

customer_reviews.title: Works Half Way
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for our first Secura wine opener. When they work, they are great. The first one was a gift. After 6 months, it would only run to eject the cork from the opener, not to remove the cork from the bottle. The replacement worked about 3 weeks and started to do the same thing. I disassembled the first one and found that the connection under the black switch would only make contact for cork ejection until I bent the metal piece farther down to activate it to remove the cork. FYI, removal of the switch by prying it up is all that is required. Disassembling the entire opener is a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ward

product_meta.title: Secura Electric Wine Opener, Automatic Electric Wine Bottle Corkscrew Opener with Foil Cutter, Rechargeable (Stainless Steel)
product_meta.description: Cordless electric wine bottle opener removes the cork in seconds; This wine opener features a Stainless Steel housing with a transparent shell surrounding the corkscrew mechanism, No guess work needed; Built-in rechargeable battery, opens up to 30 bottles on a single the secure cordless electric wine bottle opener removes the cork in seconds and with the built-in rechargeable battery It can open approximately 30 bottles of wine on a single charge. This wine bottle opener features an attractive Stainless Steel handle that fits comfortably in the palm of your hand and the transparent shell surrounding the corkscrew mechanism eliminates any need for guessing when the cork has been fully removed from the bottle. The foil cutter, included with the secure wine bottle opener, fits securely on the charging base so it is always close at hand. Simple push-button operation and elegant charging base with blue LED light make this wine bottle opener a great addition to your household appliances.
feature_bullets: Rechargeable Electric Wine Bottle Opener - Easily remove corks in seconds. Compatible with most wine bottle sizes. Open up to 30 bottles on a single charge.
Easy to Use - Simply place on top of your wine bottle, press a button, and tada, your wine is open and ready to serve.
Small Footprint Saves Space - Our electric wine bottle opener is small enough to store discreetly away when not in use. Keep the charging base next to your wine fridge, storage rack, credenza, etc.
Makes an Amazing Present - An elegant color makes our electric wine bottle opener an attractive present, or use it at home, when catering, at banquets, in restaurants or behind the bar.

Reliable product and service - 100-240V wide input voltage range covers The known voltages of most places in the world. We offer 12 months and lifetime friendly customer service. NOTE: Please charge your wine opener every three months when not in regular use, so as to extend the lifespan of the battery.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars10,452 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
